comments:
I200403100800.  I'm not sure which key is causing this, but the outline view 
becomes corrupted (i.e., stale contents) when this happens.  It requires a 
restart to restore sanity.

Is this reproducible? Probably related to bug 53869.

hm - works fine for me so far (on GTK). Sounds like the editor is already
disposed when this happens.

I don't know the trigger, but it has been happening two or three times a day 
for the past little while.

Well it's not about some specific command. The action map (fActions) is null
which is only the case when the editor has been disposed. I guess this has to do
either with some activation problems in the workbench or is a follow-up of bug
53605. Yesterday I did have bug 53605 (as usual) and suddenly my Return key no
longer worked. I am using more than one window. What's your setup? Did you have
other entries in .log?

There is nothing else relevent in the log (only a few CVS warnings about 30 
minutes before the problem occurred).  In looking at the code, it is clear that 
the outline page is being constructed on an editor part that has been disposed.  
However, it is the JavaEditor itself which makes the request to create the 
outline view.  Knowing this, would you still say that this is an editor 
management problem? 
 
If it is an editor management problem, then please reassign to Platform, UI, 
chris_mclaren@ca.ibm.com, and prepend "[EditorMgmt]" to the summary.

i can't reproduce this problem today in I200403240800. all the bugs that
commenters felt might be related to this bug have now been fixed. please reopen
if this still occurs for you.

I just saw this in I200403300800.  This exception occurred while closing 
editors in rapid succession using "Ctrl+W" (key binding for close).  Here is 
the relevent section of my log....
